briefdescription.para: Initial state, do not use.
An outgoing publish was created and submitted.
Publish is accepted.
Publish encoutered an error, linphone_event_get_reason() gives reason code.
Publish is about to expire, only sent if [sip]->refresh_generic_publish property is set to 0.
Event has been un published.
Enum for publish states.
Incoming subscription.
Outgoing subscription.
Invalid subscription direction.
Enum for subscription direction (incoming or outgoing).
Initial state, should not be used.
An outgoing subcription was sent.
An incoming subcription is received.
Subscription is pending, waiting for user approval.
Subscription is accepted.
Subscription is terminated normally.
Subscription was terminated by an error, indicated by linphone_event_get_reason()
Subscription is about to expire, only sent if [sip]->refresh_generic_subscribe property is set to 0.
Enum for subscription states.

detaileddescription.para: LinphoneSubscriptionTerminated and LinphoneSubscriptionError are final states.

memberdef.definition: typedef void(* LinphoneCoreCbsNotifyReceivedCb) (LinphoneCore *lc, LinphoneEvent *lev, const char *notified_event, const LinphoneContent *body)
memberdef.name: LinphoneCoreCbsNotifyReceivedCb

briefdescription.para: Callback prototype for notifying the application about notification received from the network.
Old name of LinphoneCoreCbsNotifyReceivedCb.
Callback prototype for notifying the application about changes of subscription states, including arrival of new subscriptions.
Old name of LinphoneCoreCbsSubscriptionStateChangedCb.

memberdef.definition: typedef void(* LinphoneCoreCbsPublishStateChangedCb) (LinphoneCore *lc, LinphoneEvent *lev, LinphonePublishState state)
memberdef.name: LinphoneCoreCbsPublishStateChangedCb

briefdescription.para: Callback prototype for notifying the application about changes of publish states.
Old name of LinphoneCoreCbsPublishStateChangedCb.
Object representing an event state, which is subcribed or published.
Enum for publish states.
Enum for subscription direction (incoming or outgoing).
Enum for subscription states.

detaileddescription.para: LinphoneSubscriptionTerminated and LinphoneSubscriptionError are final states.

memberdef.argsstring: (LinphoneCore *lc, const LinphoneAddress *resource, const char *event, int expires, const LinphoneContent *body)
memberdef.name: linphone_core_subscribe

briefdescription.para: Create an outgoing subscription, specifying the destination resource, the event name, and an optional content body.

detaileddescription.para:
If accepted, the subscription runs for a finite period, but is automatically renewed if not terminated before.
lc
the LinphoneCore
resource
the destination resource
event
the event name
expires
the whished duration of the subscription
body
an optional body, may be NULL.
a LinphoneEvent holding the context of the created subcription.

memberdef.argsstring: (LinphoneCore *lc, const LinphoneAddress *resource, const char *event, int expires)
memberdef.name: linphone_core_create_subscribe

briefdescription.para: Create an outgoing subscription, specifying the destination resource, the event name, and an optional content body.

detaileddescription.para:
If accepted, the subscription runs for a finite period, but is automatically renewed if not terminated before. Unlike linphone_core_subscribe() the subscription isn't sent immediately. It will be send when calling linphone_event_send_subscribe().
lc
the LinphoneCore
resource
the destination resource
event
the event name
expires
the whished duration of the subscription
a LinphoneEvent holding the context of the created subcription.

briefdescription.para: Create an out-of-dialog notification, specifying the destination resource, the event name.

detaileddescription.para:
The notification can be send with linphone_event_notify().
lc
the LinphoneCore
resource
the destination resource
event
the event name
a LinphoneEvent holding the context of the notification.

memberdef.argsstring: (LinphoneCore *lc, const LinphoneAddress *resource, const char *event, int expires, const LinphoneContent *body)
memberdef.name: linphone_core_publish

briefdescription.para: Publish an event state.

detaileddescription.para:
This first create a LinphoneEvent with linphone_core_create_publish() and calls linphone_event_send_publish() to actually send it. After expiry, the publication is refreshed unless it is terminated before.
lc
the LinphoneCore
resource
the resource uri for the event
event
the event name
expires
the lifetime of event being published, -1 if no associated duration, in which case it will not be refreshed.
body
the actual published data
the LinphoneEvent holding the context of the publish.

memberdef.argsstring: (LinphoneCore *lc, const LinphoneAddress *resource, const char *event, int expires)
memberdef.name: linphone_core_create_publish

briefdescription.para: Create a publish context for an event state.

detaileddescription.para:
After being created, the publish must be sent using linphone_event_send_publish(). After expiry, the publication is refreshed unless it is terminated before.
lc
the LinphoneCore
resource
the resource uri for the event
event
the event name
expires
the lifetime of event being published, -1 if no associated duration, in which case it will not be refreshed.
the LinphoneEvent holding the context of the publish.

briefdescription.para: Create a publish context for a one-shot publish.

detaileddescription.para:
After being created, the publish must be sent using linphone_event_send_publish(). The LinphoneEvent is automatically terminated when the publish transaction is finished, either with success or failure. The application must not call linphone_event_terminate() for such one-shot publish.
lc
the LinphoneCore
resource
the resource uri for the event
event
the event name
the LinphoneEvent holding the context of the publish.

briefdescription.para: Send a subscription previously created by linphone_core_create_subscribe().

parameterdescription.para: optional content to attach with the subscription.

briefdescription.para: Update (refresh) an outgoing subscription, changing the body.

parameterdescription.para: an optional body to include in the subscription update, may be NULL.

briefdescription.para: Refresh an outgoing subscription keeping the same body.
Accept an incoming subcription.
Deny an incoming subscription with given reason.
Send a notification.

parameterdescription.para: a LinphoneEvent corresponding to an incoming subscription previously received and accepted.
an optional body containing the actual notification data.

briefdescription.para: Send a publish created by linphone_core_create_publish().

parameterdescription.para: the new data to be published

briefdescription.para: Update (refresh) a publish.

parameterdescription.para: the new data to be published

briefdescription.para: Refresh an outgoing publish keeping the same body.
Prevent an event from refreshing its publish.

detaileddescription.para:
This is useful to let registrations to expire naturally (or) when the application wants to keep control on when refreshes are sent. The refreshing operations can be resumed with linphone_proxy_config_refresh_register().
lev
LinphoneEvent object.

briefdescription.para: Return reason code (in case of error state reached).
Get full details about an error occured.
Get subscription state.

detaileddescription.para: If the event object was not created by a subscription mechanism, LinphoneSubscriptionNone is returned.

briefdescription.para: Get publish state.

detaileddescription.para: If the event object was not created by a publish mechanism, LinphonePublishNone is returned.

briefdescription.para: Get subscription direction.

detaileddescription.para: If the object wasn't created by a subscription mechanism, LinphoneSubscriptionInvalidDir is returned.

briefdescription.para: Set a user (application) pointer.
Retrieve user pointer.
Add a custom header to an outgoing susbscription or publish.
Obtain the value of a given header for an incoming subscription.

simplesect.para: the header's value or NULL if such header doesn't exist.

briefdescription.para: Terminate an incoming or outgoing subscription that was previously acccepted, or a previous publication.

detaileddescription.para: The LinphoneEvent shall not be used anymore after this operation, unless the application explicitely took a reference on the object with linphone_event_ref().

briefdescription.para: Increase reference count of LinphoneEvent.

detaileddescription.para: By default LinphoneEvents created by the core are owned by the core only. An application that wishes to retain a reference to it must call linphone_event_ref(). When this reference is no longer needed, linphone_event_unref() must be called.

briefdescription.para: Decrease reference count.
Get the name of the event as specified in the event package RFC.
Get the "from" address of the subscription.
Get the resource address of the subscription or publish.
Returns back pointer to the LinphoneCore that created this LinphoneEvent.
Managing generic subscriptions and publishes.

detaileddescription.para: The LinphoneEvent api allows application to control subscriptions, receive notifications and make publish to peers, in a generic manner.
